title: Trump and Meloni talk up chances of US trade deal with Europe
description: "There will be a trade deal, 100%," Trump said, while Meloni said she was "sure" they could reach agreement.

title: We will pursue NHS if gender policies don't change, equalities watchdog warns
description: It comes after a Supreme Court ruling that the legal definition of a woman is based on biological sex.

title: Suspect in Florida university shooting that killed two is deputy sheriff's son
description: The alleged gunman is a 20-year-old student whose mother, a sheriff's deputy, owns the gun used, police say.

title: Head of British Jewish body criticises members' open letter attack on Israel
description: The president of the Board of Deputies says he disagrees with the letter criticising the war in Gaza.

title: Four dead in cable car crash south of Naples
description: The car had been traversing the 1,100m-high mountain when a cord to one of the cabins snapped say local media.

title: Review into body armour for prison staff after Abedi attack
description: The announcement comes after Manchester Arena bomber Hashem Abedi attacked prison officers at HMP Frankland.

title: Flintoff 'didn't leave house for six months' after Top Gear crash
description: The former England cricketer speaks about his recovery from the crash ahead of a new documentary.

title: Travellers warned to expect Tenerife hotel protests
description: Travellers are warned of disruption as workers stage industrial action over pay and conditions.

title: Toby Carvery owner apologises over felling of 500-year-old oak tree
description: The chief executive of the company which felled an ancient oak apologises and opens a review.

title: Israeli strikes kill Palestinians in tented area for displaced in Gaza
description: Witnesses in al-Mawasi told the BBC that people were burned alive as tents were engulfed in flames.

title: Zelensky accuses US envoy Witkoff of spreading 'Russian narratives'
description: Witkoff appeared to suggest that a peace deal hinged on the status of five Ukrainian regions.

title: Chilli vs the chiller: Lord Sugar hires new Apprentice
description: He bills the battle between Indian-flavoured pizzas and air conditioning as "chilli vs the chiller".

title: Gender ruling offers clarity after years of ambiguity
description: The ruling on the meaning of the term "woman" in law is a "victory for common sense", the EHRC's chair says.

title: What does the 'definition of a woman' ruling mean for sport?
description: The UK Supreme Court's ruling could have wide implications, including in sport.

title: Supreme Court ruling has dire consequences for trans people, campaigners warn
description: Campaigners say the trans community is now worried that "people are coming after their right to exist" as a result of the ruling.

title: Westminster's tortuous battle with the gender question
description: Sir Keir Starmer and other leaders have tied themselves in knots over the question: "What is a woman?"

title: The truth about life on other planets - and what it means for humans
description: Could discoveries of alien life ever change the human psyche in how we view ourselves and each other?

title: The products you can't bring into the UK from the EU under new ban
description: The temporary measure by the government is aimed at stopping the spread of foot and mouth disease.

title: Judge says Trump officials could be found in contempt. What happens next?
description: The Trump administration is headed on a collision course with the judicial branch, a rare and historic scenario.

title: Press photo of the year winners revealed
description: A Palestinian child coping with amputation and a young Ukrainian girl traumatised by war are among the winning images.

title: When do impressions stop being funny and start being mean?
description: Actress Aimee Lou Wood criticised a Saturday Night Live (SNL) sketch that impersonated her using exaggerated prosthetic teeth.

title: Watch: BBC joins retirees aboard China's 'silver trains' that aim to boost economy
description: China is encouraging it's retirees to spend their savings on fun initiatives to help boost its economy, as the country's trade war with the US rages on.

title: 'Romeo and Juliet' clause exempts teachers from reporting consensual teen sex
description: The Crime and Policing Bill puts a new duty on teachers, GPs, and other professionals to report concerns or face criminal sanctions.

title: Murder arrest as golf course crash victim named
description: The woman died in hospital on Tuesday, after being struck by a van involved in a police chase on Friday.

title: Robert Jenrick adds hundreds to WhatsApp group in mix-up
description: Hundreds of contacts were mistakenly added to a group set up to promote the Tory MP's marathon run.

title: Edward Colston plaque installed where slave trader's statue was torn down
description: The plaque outlining his role in the slave trade is installed despite being labelled "shameful".

title: Teachers will rally against Labour over pay, says union leader
description: The National Education Union's general secretary says Labour MPs could pay a 'high political price'.

title: BBC News app
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: The Supreme Court’s Ruling on Sex and Gender: What’s the Impact on the NHS?
description: NHS could be forced to change gender guidance.

title: How the ‘world’s coolest dictator’ is helping Trump
description: El Salvador’s president has become a key White House ally

title: The story behind Simon and Garfunkel's most famous album
description: The story behind Simon and Garfunkel's most famous album, Bridge over Troubled Water.

title: Dobey beats Bunting for Rotterdam triumph
description: Chris Dobey wins his first Premier League night of 2025 with a 6-2 win over Stephen Bunting on an evening of shocks in Rotterdam.

title: Flintoff 'didn't leave house for six months' after crash
description: The former England cricketer speaks about his recovery from the crash ahead of a new documentary.

title: Norris being forced to drive in 'uncomfortable ways'
description: Lando Norris is leading the drivers' championship but says he is being forced to drive in a different way in order to get the best out of his car.
